name: postgresql_high_rollback_rate_incident
description: This incident type refers to a situation where the Postgresql database has a high rollback rate, which means that a high percentage of transactions are being aborted compared to the committed ones. This can cause issues with data consistency and performance, and may require investigation and resolution by the responsible team. The incident details may include information about the affected database instance, the service or system impacted, the urgency level, and any related alerts or escalations.

cells.name: cell_1
cells.content:
## Postgresql high rollback rate incident
This incident type refers to a situation where the Postgresql database has a high rollback rate, which means that a high percentage of transactions are being aborted compared to the committed ones. This can cause issues with data consistency and performance, and may require investigation and resolution by the responsible team. The incident details may include information about the affected database instance, the service or system impacted, the urgency level, and any related alerts or escalations.

cells.name: cell_2
cells.content: ## Check the status of the PostgreSQL service

cells.name: cell_3
cells.content: (host | host_name=$HOST_NAME) union (pod | k8s_cluster_name=$K8S_CLUSTER_NAME | namespace=$NAMESPACE) | `systemctl status postgresql`

cells.name: cell_4
cells.content: ## Check the PostgreSQL logs for any errors

cells.name: cell_5
cells.content: (host | host_name=$HOST_NAME) union (pod | k8s_cluster_name=$K8S_CLUSTER_NAME | namespace=$NAMESPACE) | `journalctl -u postgresql`

cells.name: cell_6
cells.content: ## Check the PostgreSQL configuration file for any issues

cells.name: cell_7
cells.content: (host | host_name=$HOST_NAME) union (pod | k8s_cluster_name=$K8S_CLUSTER_NAME | namespace=$NAMESPACE) | `cat /etc/postgresql/main/postgresql.conf`

cells.name: cell_8
cells.content: ## Check the current connections to PostgreSQL and their status

cells.name: cell_9
cells.content: (host | host_name=$HOST_NAME) union (pod | k8s_cluster_name=$K8S_CLUSTER_NAME | namespace=$NAMESPACE) | `psql -U ${DATABASE_USERNAME} -h ${DATABASE_HOST} -c "SELECT * FROM pg_stat_activity;"`

cells.name: cell_10
cells.content: ## Check the PostgreSQL version installed

cells.name: cell_11
cells.content: (host | host_name=$HOST_NAME) union (pod | k8s_cluster_name=$K8S_CLUSTER_NAME | namespace=$NAMESPACE) | `psql --version`

cells.name: cell_12
cells.content: ## Check the system resources being used by PostgreSQL

cells.name: cell_13
cells.content: (host | host_name=$HOST_NAME) union (pod | k8s_cluster_name=$K8S_CLUSTER_NAME | namespace=$NAMESPACE) | `top`

cells.name: cell_14
cells.content: ## Check the disk usage and available space

cells.name: cell_15
cells.content: (host | host_name=$HOST_NAME) union (pod | k8s_cluster_name=$K8S_CLUSTER_NAME | namespace=$NAMESPACE) | `df -h`

cells.name: cell_16
cells.content: ## Check the PostgreSQL database for any inconsistencies

cells.name: cell_17
cells.content: (host | host_name=$HOST_NAME) union (pod | k8s_cluster_name=$K8S_CLUSTER_NAME | namespace=$NAMESPACE) | `psql -U ${DATABASE_USERNAME} -h ${DATABASE_HOST} -c "CHECK TABLE ${TABLE_NAME}"`

cells.name: cell_18
cells.content: ## Check the PostgreSQL database for any corrupted data

cells.name: cell_19
cells.content: (host | host_name=$HOST_NAME) union (pod | k8s_cluster_name=$K8S_CLUSTER_NAME | namespace=$NAMESPACE) | `psql -U ${DATABASE_USERNAME} -h ${DATABASE_HOST} -c "SELECT * FROM pg_database WHERE datname = '${DATABASE_NAME}'"`

cells.name: cell_20
cells.content: ## Check the PostgreSQL database for any deadlocks

cells.name: cell_21
cells.content: (host | host_name=$HOST_NAME) union (pod | k8s_cluster_name=$K8S_CLUSTER_NAME | namespace=$NAMESPACE) | `psql -U ${DATABASE_USERNAME} -h ${DATABASE_HOST} -c "SELECT * FROM pg_locks WHERE NOT granted;"`

cells.name: cell_22
cells.content: ## Check the PostgreSQL database for the current transaction status

cells.name: cell_23
cells.content: (host | host_name=$HOST_NAME) union (pod | k8s_cluster_name=$K8S_CLUSTER_NAME | namespace=$NAMESPACE) | `psql -U ${DATABASE_USERNAME} -h ${DATABASE_HOST} -c "SELECT * FROM pg_stat_database WHERE datname = '${DATABASE_NAME}'"`

cells.name: cell_24
cells.content: ## Measure the rollback rate

cells.name: cell_25
cells.content: host | host_name=$HOST_NAME | invoke_pg_stat_rollback_rate()

cells.name: cell_26
cells.content: ## Optimize the database configuration to reduce the frequency of rollbacks. Adjusting the database settings can help to optimize the rollback rate.

cells.name: cell_27
cells.content: host | host_name=$HOST_NAME | invoke_db_config_optimization($DATABASE_PASSWORD, $DATABASE_NAME, $DATABASE_HOST, $DATABASE_PORT)
